derivedFrom.description: Chile celebrated International Labor Day on Tuesday as thousands marched downtown Santiago along Alameda in honor of workers’ rights.
derivedFrom.headline: May 1st March: Hooded men threaten to set fire to bank branches; Marcha 1 de mayo: Encapuchados provocan amagos de incendio en sucursales bancarias

derivedFrom.description: GUATEMALA CITY – Guatemalan troops and police have occupied an Indian community in the northwestern province of Huehuetenango after disturbances that left one person dead, a Defense Ministry spokesman said Wednesday.
derivedFrom.headline: Guatemala Imposes State of Siege on Rebellious Town
derivedFrom.comments: From Latin American Herald Tribune article: "Guatemalan troops and police have occupied an Indian community in the northwestern province of Huehuetenango after disturbances that left one person dead, a Defense Ministry spokesman said Wednesday...Nearly 700 soldiers and police are patrolling the community...

derivedFrom.description: The demonstrators, joined by students protesting non-payment of salaries of about 100 men working on expanding local mall.
derivedFrom.headline: Protest leaves 11 workers arrested in downtown Concepción; Protesta de trabajadores deja 11 detenidos en centro de Concepción

derivedFrom.description: Taxi drivers from Colón Island in Bocas del Toro province went on strike  as a protest for the operation permits granted to other vehicles in order to render tourism transportation services.
derivedFrom.headline: Taxistas de Isla Colón suspenden su paro [Taxi drivers from Colón Island in Bocas del Toro go on strike]

derivedFrom.description: Reports suggest thousands of people attended the controversial “Marijuana March” on Saturday afternoon in Rio’s Zona Sul (South Zone). The rally, which is now held in over 700 cities worldwide, celebrates Cannabis and defends the use of the drug as being part of a lifestyle choice. Reports indicate some protestors threw rocks at a police car and in retaliation rubber bullets were fired, hitting at least one, drawing a close to the protest.
derivedFrom.headline: Marcha da Maconha reúne mais de 2 mil pessoas na Zona Sul do Rio de Janeiro ("Marihuana March" Brings Together More than 2000 People in the Southern Zone of Rio de Janeiro)

derivedFrom.description: Strike by truck drivers demanding increased wages.  Over 7500 truckers and 6,000 trucks will not work to transport the nations goods until an agreement on taxes and wages is made. The strike will cost the nation 2 million dollars a day.
derivedFrom.headline: Transportistas de carga en huelga [Truckers on strike]

derivedFrom.description: Five civilians, a TV camera man, and two police officers were wounded by rocks in street fighting yesterday, on day two of the city-wide transportation strike.  Transportation workers have taken up solidarity strikes in six departments of Bolivia including La Paz, Oruro, Pando, Beni, Chuquisaca, Potosí and Bolivia has been brought to a virtual stand-still.
derivedFrom.headline: Unemployment leads to violence and threatens to radicalize; El paro genera violencia y amenaza con radicalizarse
derivedFrom.comments: solidarity strikes in six departments of Bolivia including La Paz, Oruro, Pando, Beni, Chuquisaca, Potosí. Maybe should be coded as nationwide.

derivedFrom.description:
Bursts of gunfire and dozens of tear gas around the prison Plant sit for about 15 minutes, where more than 1,600 prisoners of flags that are still in prison located in Paradise and have resisted be transferred to other prisons. 


Meanwhile, the families who stay at the entrance of Plant guard and discussed with the police, baffled by what is happening, and asserted that "it is a slaughter" and that their imprisoned relatives are shooting at them "sniper" from the high of Paradise.
derivedFrom.headline: Fire closed in jail Plant Paradise
derivedFrom.comments: Article is from the Open Source Center.

derivedFrom.description: Residents of the area surrounding the road to El Junquito protesting the failure of public services, coupled with patching work performed in that artery, were the source of the kilometer-long tail that affected traffic up and down in the Tuesday morning.
derivedFrom.headline: Trancan via a El Junquito por Protesta vecinal (Neighborhood Protest Cuts Road to El Junquito)

derivedFrom.description: Over 7500 truckers and 6,000 trucks will not work to transport the nations goods until an agreement on taxes and wages is made. The strike will cost the nation 2 million dollars a day.
derivedFrom.headline: Truckers on Strike

derivedFrom.description: Last Wednesday, the Central Obrera Boliviana (Bolivia Workers’s Center – COB) started its first day of strike with college students, health and mining workers ranking the mobilization. The strike caused violence which was responded with tear gas by the police, which lead to the injury and detention of some protesters. In La Paz and Potosí 80% of the population attended the strike. Cochabama only witnessed 40% of mobilization.
derivedFrom.headline: The country stuck after seven weeks of conflict; El país atascado tras siete semanas de conflictos
derivedFrom.comments: Coded the population as "General Population" because 80% of the population participated.

derivedFrom.description:
Last Wednesday, the Central Obrera Boliviana (Bolivia Workers’s Center – COB) started its first day of strike with college students, health and mining workers ranking the mobilization. The strike caused violence which was responded with tear gas by the police, which lead to the injury and detention of some protesters.

In La Paz and Potosí 80% of the population attended the strike. Cochabama only witnessed 40% of mobilization.
derivedFrom.headline: The country stuck after seven weeks of conflict; El país atascado tras siete semanas de conflictos
derivedFrom.comments: Coded the population as "General Population" because 80% of the population participated.

derivedFrom.description: A massive march organized by the Departmental Labor Federation (COD) toured the main streets of downtown Cochabamba to demand union demands on the third day of general strike.
derivedFrom.headline: Mass march of COD paralyzed downtown Cochabamba; Masiva marcha de la COD paraliza el centro de Cochabamba
derivedFrom.comments: NOT AN EMPLOYMENT/WAGES STRIKE, SHOULD BE LABELED 0142, SINCE THE ISSUES ARE NOT EXPLICITELY STATED IN THE NEWS REPORT

derivedFrom.description: The protest is in opposition to recent unnotified reduction in school hours guaranteed to students.
derivedFrom.headline: Teachers protest

derivedFrom.description: Bank clerks belonging to La Bancaria (AB) held a massive protest march yesterday in downtown Buenos Aires. The clerks were marching in rejection of the 18 percent pay rise tabled by the banks during wage negotiations, claiming a number closer to 26 percent was more appropriate.
derivedFrom.headline: Bank Employees March and Threaten To Strike; Los bancarios marcharon y amenazan con huelgas

derivedFrom.description: In response to yesterday’s national UOM strike, the Labour Ministry extended the compulsory conciliation for a further five days. The metal workers union is calling for a wage increase of 25 percent against the offer by private companies of a 15 percent increase.
derivedFrom.headline: After the Settling of the Last Minutes Offers, The Salary Ceiling Climbs to 24%; Tras el arreglo de la UOM, el techo para firmar pasó a 24%

derivedFrom.description: Court clerks in Buenos Aires province yesterday organized a protest demanding increased wages
derivedFrom.headline: Traffic chaos by a workers' protest in the city center; Caos de tránsito por una protesta de trabajadores judiciales en el centro
derivedFrom.comments: The Argentina Independent article give information but the strike hadnt happened yet therefore not used as first reported  date

derivedFrom.description: Striking Bolivian workers and university students marched in the city center of the capital La Paz . Bolivian police clashed with protesters on the second day of a three-day strike against the government’s plan to increase health workers and doctors’ working time by two hours.
derivedFrom.headline: The Health Care Strike Is Unprecedented due to the Support of the Physicians; La huelga de salud es inédita por el protagonismo de los médicos
derivedFrom.comments: mine workers in El Alto also staged a demonstration

derivedFrom.description: Striking Bolivian workers and university students marched in the city center of the capital La Paz . Bolivian police clashed with protesters on the second day of a three-day strike against the government’s plan to increase health workers and doctors’ working time by two hours.
derivedFrom.headline: The Health Care Strike Is Unprecedented due to the Support of the Physicians; La huelga de salud es inédita por el protagonismo de los médicos
derivedFrom.comments: mine workers in El Alto also staged a demonstration

derivedFrom.description: a "violent confrontation" between farmers, who reject tax increases, and Kirchnerite La Campora militants, who tried to block their access to the building
derivedFrom.headline: Violent confrontation between farmers and the La Campora; Violento enfrentamiento entre productores y La Cámpora

derivedFrom.description: More than 8,000 people, among indigenous, Afro-descendants, and peasants are taking part since Thursday in a peaceful march, which for three days will cover northern Cauca municipalities affected by the armed conflict.
derivedFrom.headline: Población del Norte del Cauca se une en clamor por la paz [Indigenous Groups, Peasants March for Peace in Cauca]

derivedFrom.description: Hundreds of Guyanese from several communities across the country on Thursday staged yet another picketing action outside the Parliament buildings on Brickdam, Georgetown against the budget cuts by the AFC and APNU.
derivedFrom.headline: Ameriindians, others Protest Threats to their Livelihood
derivedFrom.comments: Article is from the Open Source Center.

derivedFrom.description: Under the slogan "The practices are not traded," student teachers held a rally yesterday in active general strike. Protest that in several schools in Montevideo, without notice, are pulling the hours of practice and awarded to students who are pursuing second and third year of teaching.
derivedFrom.headline: Teachers protest cancellation of practice

derivedFrom.description:
A protest held closed neighborhood Pan American Highway to kilometer 30, near the National Guard post Morocha Door.

 The protesters are demanding that Metro Los Teques immediately restore the gateway in the industry, a truck knocked the company two months ago.
derivedFrom.headline: Pan American Highway closed by protesting neighbors

derivedFrom.description:
The passing vehicle in Chuao, at the height of the CCCT, held closed by a protest staged Unefa students because of the appalling conditions and delays in administrative procedures within the school grounds.
 Young took a truckload of Empresas Polar to close the passage, which has generated a mega queue in the vicinity of the Black Cube.
 Graduates of the house of studies report that have been waiting for their degrees two years. They also require that the room is free for students.
derivedFrom.headline: Protest at UNEFA causes mega traffic jam

derivedFrom.description: I witnessed a picketing exercise on Friday, May 11 in the vicinity of the Regional Chairman’s Office and also near the Guyana Rice Development Board Office in Region Two (Pomeroon-Supenaam), and having read all of the placards, talked to a few persons who were in the picketing line, and also read most of the daily newspapers that carry the farmers stories, one would be led to believe that the Mahaicony Rice Mill may have owed farmers in this region  large sums of money for paddy over a lengthy period of time.
derivedFrom.headline: Why are Region 2 farmers not being paid if government last year gave rice milling company a cash injection?
derivedFrom.comments:
The link in column M specifies the protest began on May 11: Rice farmers along the Essequibo Coast are calling on Government to intervene in the matter where the Mahaicony Rice Mills (MRL) is yet to pay outstanding sums owed to them.
Several of these farmers on Friday, last, staged a protest in their region as they complained about the actions of this rice mill. They voiced their concerns with regards to the delayed payments by the company. One man explained that he wanted the owner of the MRL to meet with the farmers and discuss the terms of their payments. The link in columns N specifies the location.  Link in S verifies some activity by rise farmers in Region 2.  Link is from Stabroek.

derivedFrom.description: Praça Nossa Senhora da Paz in Ipanema was at the center of a protest demonstration against plans to remove 113 trees during the implementation of a new Metro subway line.
derivedFrom.headline: Moradores fazem manifestação contra obras do metrô na Nossa Senhora da Paz (Residents Demonstrate against Metro Work in Nossa Senhora da Paz)

derivedFrom.description: On its Facebook page, “IndignadosCR,” the group announced a rally on May 12th, at 12 p.m. in the Plaza de la Cultura, in downtown San José, to “celebrate the fight for a better Costa Rica [by] collecting signatures and publicizing initiatives.” invitation is also asking people to join a “national action plan for a Costa Rica without corruption,” a citizen initiative that responds to “serious corruption cases that have been made public recently,” the group stated.
derivedFrom.headline: ‘Outraged’ Costa Ricans celebrate movement’s first anniversary
derivedFrom.comments: This event is reported before it happened. RD: this encoding is subject to further review. [Analyst comment: GSS source reported that the rally was taking place May 12th.  [Analyst] Could not find later reporting in GSS sources but found other article that event took place.

derivedFrom.description: National Medical Negotiating Commission (Comenenal) to call for the revival of the law on the public-private association (Comenenal), as well as to protest attempts to impose a salary scale and the hiring of foreign physicians.  They were also protesting the deterioration of medical conditions in the country.
derivedFrom.headline: Comenenal decreta paro escalonado de labores [Comenenal decrees staggered work stoppage]
derivedFrom.comments: this article reports on two health care work stoppages.  One is the Comenenal on the 13th and the other the CSS who are to begin their strike the next day.  These strikes are about more than just wages. LABELED 0151 SINCE IT IS  ABOUT OVERNMENT POLICIES

derivedFrom.description: over 160 journalists verbalized their claim to exercise press freedom, urged the government to respect access to public information, and protested against the lack of press conferences by the president.
derivedFrom.headline: Claim to exercise press freedom; Reclamo para ejercer la libertad de prensa

derivedFrom.description: A dozen AeroSur workers declared themselves on strike Monday at La Paz's international airport, saying they were going on a hunger strike, union leader Elias Quispe said. The company has more than 1,000 employees and Quispe said none have been paid for at least three months.
derivedFrom.headline: Employees begin extreme measures at AreoSur; Empleados de AeroSur inician medida extrema

derivedFrom.description: CSS Health care workers go on strike
derivedFrom.headline: Comenenal decreta paro escalonado de labores [Comenenal decrees staggered work stoppage]
derivedFrom.comments: Headlines fixed; GSS sources in Col Q

derivedFrom.description:
The Journalism program for dozens of journalists demonstrated against the policy of the government of Cristina Fernandez, respond to certain issues 
At the repeated cry of "We Ask", a group of journalists from various media and were rated "not official", there was live ask demanding issues such as inflation, YPF, the case Ciccone and even the state of health of the president
derivedFrom.headline: Lanata journalists gathered to protest government ruling

derivedFrom.description: About 2000 Uruguayans protested in front of the Plaza Independencia, against the increased violence and insecurity of the nation and demanded immediate measure to beef up security.
derivedFrom.headline: Protesters handed proclamation to the President
derivedFrom.comments: The "other link" is from a source in the GSS but the source is from Argentina, not Uruguay.

derivedFrom.description: Downtown Buenos Aires has been brought to a standstill once again due to traffic blocks along the 9 de Julio Avenue. Protesters from the food industry blocked all lanes in both directions. They are demonstrating against job cuts in the industry and demand better wages.
derivedFrom.headline: Traffic in chaos because of workers' protest in the center square; Caos de tránsito por una protesta de trabajadores judiciales en el centro

derivedFrom.description: Costa Rican fuel truck drivers went on strike  Tuesday, 5/15/2012. The strike is a response to a government decision not to renew permits for 100 older model fuel trucks. Strike was settled on 5/16  after a two-hour meeting with government representatives.
derivedFrom.headline: Transportistas de combustible ceden y concilian con Gobierno [Fuel truck operators reconcile with government]
derivedFrom.comments: This event is reported before it happened in Tico Times.  La Nacion had later reporting as the strike was settled. Links to both articles provided

derivedFrom.description: Breakaway AGTSyP Buenos Aires subway system workers started a 36-hour strike at midday that was paralyzing the entire underground system, causing transport difficulties throughout the city.
derivedFrom.headline: Buses Overcrowded and Serious Problems Caused by Strike; Colectivos desbordados y graves problemas por el paro

derivedFrom.description: Santa Cruz health workers rejected the agreement signed yesterday by the administration and the National Confederation of Health Workers. An indefinite strike begins today.
derivedFrom.headline: Care is irregular in hospitals in Santa Cruz; La atención es irregular en los hospitales de Santa Cruz

derivedFrom.description:
Tillage operators at the Wales Sugar Estate began strike action on Wednesday to oppose the proposed change in the beginning of their working day and it continued yesterday.

However, Guyana Agricultural and General Workers Union (GAWU) official Aslim Singh told Stabroek News that the workers are expected to resume work today following a meeting with senior GuySuCo officials sometime during yesterday.
derivedFrom.headline:
Tillage workers at Wales end strike

– talks on working hours to continue

derivedFrom.description: Mobile Riot Control Squads] of the [National] Police [PN] had to intervene in rural areas of the towns of San Luis de Palenque and Trinidad, in Casanare Department, to stop rioting by demonstrators in conflict with Alange Energy Corporation, a Canadian oil company. About 150 hooded horseman arrived to the conflict and took over the oil depot, costing 12 billion Colombian pesos as of 5/19/2012
derivedFrom.headline: Jinetes encapuchados bloquean petroleras [Masked Riders Disrupt Oil Production in Casanare]

derivedFrom.description: Mobile Riot Control Squads] of the [National] Police [PN] had to intervene in rural areas of the towns of San Luis de Palenque and Trinidad, in Casanare Department, to stop rioting by demonstrators in conflict with Alange Energy Corporation, a Canadian oil company. About 150 hooded horseman arrived to the conflict and took over the oil depot, costing 12 billion Colombian pesos as of 5/19/2012
derivedFrom.headline: Jinetes encapuchados bloquean petroleras [Masked Riders Disrupt Oil Production in Casanare]

derivedFrom.description: The Confederation of University Students of Chile (Confech) organized its second march of the year on Wednesday. The event brought together more than 100,000 students and supporters from across the country. The march was relatively peaceful, though there were some scattered acts of violence, and police arrested at least ten “encapuchados,” or hooded vandals, after the closing speeches.
derivedFrom.headline: CONFECH requires the government $ 5,000 million for Education on the verge of speech May 21; Confech exige al gobierno US$ 5.000 millones para Educación en la antesala de discurso del 21 de mayo

derivedFrom.description: 300 employees of the contracting firms of Northern National Copper Company (Codelco) blockaded the access road between Calama and Chuquicamata in the Fifth Region on 17 May, while other groups blockaded the access roads to Gaby, Hales, and Rodomiro Tomic copper deposits. The workers held the demonstrations to protest the changes made to their shift work system and because the Northern Codelco has failed to pay them employee benefits.
derivedFrom.headline: Codelco announced that they will operate normally despite the mobilization of contract workers; Codelco anuncia que opera con normalidad pese a movilización de trabajadores contratistas

derivedFrom.description:
At 8 began a heavy fire in the prison of La Planta. Neighbors sector report that they have heard six loud explosions, similar to grenades. 

A group of relatives of inmates, along with some motorized, moved to the Palace of Miraflores to demand response to the situation.
derivedFrom.headline: Shooting generates anxiety around Plant

derivedFrom.description: Venezuelan indigenous miners who blocked the Trunk Road 10, which connects Venezuela with Brazil, decided to lift the protest they staged since last Thursday after agreeing to hold a meeting with Bolívar State Governor Francisco Rangel Gomez on 24 May Santa Elena de Uairén.
derivedFrom.headline: Venezuelan Miners Lift Protest on Border with Brazil

derivedFrom.description: Residents of Freirina, a town in Chile’s northern Atacama region, have been blocking the entry into the plant since Thursday to protest the awful-smelling odor emitted by the plant.
derivedFrom.headline: High tension in Freirina in protest of smell of plant, Agrosuper; Alta tensión en Freirina en protesta por olor de planta Agrosuper

derivedFrom.description: Protesters in Honduras's Mosquito Coast region have burned down government offices and demanded that the US Drug Enforcement Administration leave the area, after it emerged some of its agents were involved in an anti-drug operation in which police killed four innocent people, including two pregnant women.
derivedFrom.headline: Hondurans protest  DEA role in fatal shootings

derivedFrom.description: A large-scale march was staged by inhabitants of the northern city of Calama, considered the mining capital of Chile, who demand the allocation of more resources to copper mining cities.
derivedFrom.headline:
With marches and barricades began a protest against Fondenor in Calama; 
Con marchas y barricadas se inició en Calama protesta contra el Fondenor

derivedFrom.description: Several members of Ngabe-Bugle protesters tried to occupy the Barro Blanco Hydroelectric plant.  Repelled by police with pepper spray
derivedFrom.headline: Ngäbes-Bugle try to enter the Barro Blanco Hydroelectric Plant

derivedFrom.description: The taxi drivers of La Villa de Los Santos were asking the Ground Transit and Transportation Authority (ATTT) to allow them to pick up fares in the city of Chitré and thus “reduce their expenses”.  They claim that, every time they try to pick up a fare in Chitré, the ATT “persecutes” them.  Since the ATTT refused to grant this permission, they staged this protest, which involved parking their vehicles in a location that blocked traffic to and from Chitré during the midday hours.
derivedFrom.headline: Taxistas bloquean paso por el puente de La Villa de Los Santos [Taxi drivers block passage through the bridge of La Villa de Los Santos]
derivedFrom.comments: Where exactly do taxi drivers fit?  We don't have a category for transportation.   General Population?  Since it is about the ATTT granting permission, I'm coding it "other governmental policies" but not sure that fits exactly.

derivedFrom.description:
At 5:45 am on Friday closed the highway 200 mototaxistas Mariches-La Dolorita to protest the deaths of two classmates over the past two weeks.

 With their bikes blockaded the entrances to the Vista Hermosa sectors, Guaicoco, Palo Verde, Lomas del Avila, Turumo, Park and Carimao Caiza.

 The protesters asked for more patrols, operating checkpoints and National Guard and police in Sucre and Miranda.
derivedFrom.headline: Protest of pedicab drivers in Maricha

derivedFrom.description: Thousands of university students have marched through central Mexico City to protest against a bias in media coverage that they say favours the candidate of the former ruling party in upcoming presidential elections.
derivedFrom.headline: Mexican students protest against bias in election coverage
derivedFrom.comments: The last line in The Guardian article states "A march through central Mexico City on Saturday drew tens of thousands of protesters against Peña Nieto."

derivedFrom.description: Workers at Enmore Sugar Estate yesterday began strike action after a letter was sent from GuySuCo to the Guyana Agricultural and General Workers Union (GAWU) stating that it would be unable to pay the workers their ‘back pay’.
derivedFrom.headline: Enmore sugar workers strike, as Wales’ ends

derivedFrom.description: Mining workers went on strike accusing their mining company of not complying with labor laws and mistreatment of workers. The strike was peaceful but they did block access to the mine. The strike will cost the mining company millions.
derivedFrom.headline: Inician huelga en la Triton Minera S.A. [Strike at Mina Limon]

derivedFrom.description:
Thousands of students and Chilean workers staged a demostration today near the National Congress, in parallel with the third yearly accountability report by the government headed by Sebastián Piñera.

...violent clashes that left two police injured and dozens of people in custody.

Though convened by the CUT to demand an increase in the minimum wage to the equivalent of $500 a month, the demonstration also drew support from students and educators unhappy with a highly stratified education system that funnels state subsidies to private, for-profit institutions.
derivedFrom.headline: Reported that two detectives were wounded during incidents in Valparaiso; Denuncian que dos detectives resultaron heridos durante incidentes en Valparaíso
derivedFrom.comments: No specific reason is given for the event.  0162 is correct.

derivedFrom.description: The authorities and the population of the province of Espinar Cusco begin an indefinite strike today to demand that the mining company Xstrata Tintaya increase the annual payment of its profits to the municipality from 3% to 30%.  They also ask for an environmental study on the effects of mining in Espinar, especially in rivers.
derivedFrom.headline: Paro indefinido en Espinar por más aportes de Xstrata Tintaya (Indefinite Strike in Espinar for More Contributions by Xstrata Tintaya)

derivedFrom.description:
Thousands of students and Chilean workers staged a demostration today near the National Congress, in parallel with the third yearly accountability report by the government headed by Sebastián Piñera.

...violent clashes that left two police injured and dozens of people in custody.

Though convened by the CUT to demand an increase in the minimum wage to the equivalent of $500 a month, the demonstration also drew support from students and educators unhappy with a highly stratified education system that funnels state subsidies to private, for-profit institutions.
derivedFrom.headline: Reported that two detectives were wounded during incidents in Valparaiso; Denuncian que dos detectives resultaron heridos durante incidentes en Valparaíso

derivedFrom.description: EFE workers, who gathered in protest from the early hours of Tuesday morning, focusing on the villages, in Polar.
derivedFrom.headline: EFE workers continue protest in Los Cortijos

derivedFrom.description: The anti-mining protest in Espinar heats up.  On the second day of the indefinite strike against the mining company Xstrata Tintaya, some 300 farmers clashed with police. Two protesters were injured.
derivedFrom.headline: Dos heridos deja protesta contra Xstrata en Espinar (Two People Injured in Protest against Xstrata)

derivedFrom.description: The Broad Progressive Front (FAP), led by Socialist Hermes Binner, demonstrated in front of the historic Cabildo building, while several PRO and Federal Peronism lawmakers joined in a symbolic embrace in front of the Tribunales Courthouse in order to demand “an independent justice system.”  According to the organizers, close to 5,000 people attended the rally
derivedFrom.headline: Calls for Independent Justice Review of Macrismo (right-wing bloc] and Federal Peronism; El macrismo y el peronismo federal pidieron una Justicia independiente
derivedFrom.comments: Not sure of the exact date. Entered the 22nd as a best guess.

derivedFrom.description: This morning dozens of farmers blocked Route 5 South, off of San Javier, in the Maule Region, to protest against a decision of the Court of Appeals of Talca by the use of the waters of the Laguna del Maule that favors the multinational Endesa. Water cannons were used to disperse the demonstrators. Finally, several farmers were arrested and police restored traffic.
derivedFrom.headline: Farmers blocked Route 5 South for a water conflict with Endesa in the Maule; Agricultores bloquearon Ruta 5 Sur por conflicto de agua con Endesa en el Maule

derivedFrom.description: The FAA’s Argentine Rural Federation president Eduardo Buzzi accused the national government of implementing an agricultural policy that “is benefiting large corporations while exterminating small farmers.” He also rejected again the “tax hike” that Buenos Aires Governor Daniel Scioli is pushing through a provincial tax reform bill, which includes increases in rural property taxes. Growers from the provinces of Buenos Aires, Entre Ríos, Córdoba, Mendoza, Chaco, La Pampa and Santa Fe participated in the protest.
derivedFrom.headline:
Field tractorazo : this time aimed against Scioli;
Tractorazo del campo: esta vez apuntaron contra Scioli

derivedFrom.description: Students are opposed to the recommendation from IMF to reduce education subsidies and utilize the money in different areas of the economy.
derivedFrom.headline: Estudiantes marchan contra propuesta del FMI [Students march against recommendations from the  International Monetary Fund]

derivedFrom.description: Leftist organizations and Colombian residents in Argentina were demonstrating a few metres away from the Gran Rex theatre in protest of the presence of former Colombian president Álvaro Uribe, whom they accuse of committing “heinous crimes against the people of his country.”
derivedFrom.headline:
Uribe among protests and a strong police operation; 
Uribe, entre protestas y un fuerte operativo policial

derivedFrom.description: Thousands of university students have marched through central Mexico City to protest against a bias in media coverage that they say favours the candidate of the former ruling party in upcoming presidential elections.
derivedFrom.headline: Mexican students protest against bias in election coverage
derivedFrom.comments: The lead in the LA Times article states "Thousands of university students poured into the streets of Mexico City on Wednesday for the second time in a week to protest the way the upcoming presidential election is being run and, more specifically, covered in the Mexican media." Also, the WSJ covered the story, but you need to be a subscriber to read the full story. Lastly, the Washington Post published a story at the end of May that says "At a dozen large rallies over the past two weeks in several major cities, thousands of young people protested what they see as media manipulation and thwarted democracy."

derivedFrom.description: (translated) Thousands of Mexican students marched in protest against the "manipulation" political and media as part of a student movement as part of the process that ends with the presidential election on July 1.
derivedFrom.headline: Estudiantes mexicanos marchan contra “manipulación” mediática y política
derivedFrom.comments: (translated from article) In Guadalajara (West), about a thousand young people from at least four public and private universities gathered at Chapultepec Avenue, considered one of the spaces of cultural expression in the city to reach the regional headquarters of Televisa.

derivedFrom.description:
Electrical workers have one week to protest their grievances against violations of the collective agreement and now the appointment of a new commissioner, former deputy to the NA, Hugo Marquez. 

The workers made a rally at the headquarters of Corpoelec in Puerto La Cruz and march to the Public Prosecutor's Office to request the removal of Marquez, for his appointment "a finger", a violation of workers' control.
derivedFrom.headline: Electrical workers in Anzoategui protest
derivedFrom.comments: Article is from the Open Source Center.  Link in Q is from El Universal.

derivedFrom.description: From the early hours of Thursday, workers at the University of Los Andes (ULA) rose in protest to demand fixed charges to the Ministry for Higher Education, collapsing the main roads of the city of Merida.
derivedFrom.headline: Workers protest collapses ULA Merida

derivedFrom.description: Civic organizations in the German Busch province of Santa Cruz have called a strike in order to demand the resumption of activity at the Mutun mining project.
derivedFrom.headline: Civic Groups Close the Border and Strike in Defense of the Mutun Iron Ore Field; Cívicos cierran la frontera y paran en defensa del Mutún

derivedFrom.description: Around 5000 protesters congregated outside the national congress in Asunción on Friday, contesting the potential passing of a law that would secure 150 thousand million guaraníes (US$ 34.5 thousand) for each political party to employ members of the Tribunal Superior de la Justicia Electoral (Electoral Justice Tribunal – TSJE). The protest was organised by a group calling themselves  the ‘After Office Revolucionarios‘ (After Office Revolutionaries), who mobilised support via social networking sites.
derivedFrom.headline: After Office Revolucionario: “La gente escribía sus carteles y colgaba sus banderas ahí", relata Urbieta ("The People Wrote Their Posters and Hung Their Banners There", says Urbieta)

derivedFrom.description: University students protested for various reasons including, the high cost of living, the fuel problem, they also called for an investigation of government corruption, and they expressed their sympathy with the Indians who are fighting against the Barro Blanco hydro electric project
derivedFrom.headline: University groups closed four sections of the Transisthmus Highway
derivedFrom.comments: This reason for this protest was coded as "other" because there were multiple reasons for the protest.

derivedFrom.description: The demonstration, called "Bottling equity", seeks to demonstrate the impact that road and mall building would have on the town. The construction of a shopping mall in Castro continues to divide the population of the southern city. In protest to the work, between 150 and 200 vehicles took to the streets today and San Martín Serrano, to simulate, according to the organizers, the impact it would have in mall traffic on the streets.
derivedFrom.headline: Approximately 200 Vehicles Block Streets in Protest against the Commercial Center of Castro; Cerca de 200 vehículos colapsaron calles en protesta por centro comercial de Castro

derivedFrom.description: San Pedro Sula Tiempo.hn reports that several demonstrations snarled traffic in the nation's capital Tegucigalpa yesterday as three separate demonstrations took to the streets. Public secondary school students marched to demand the administration pay the student bonus
derivedFrom.headline: Caos vial: Caliente jornada de protestas en la capital [Road chaos: Warm day of protests in the capital]

derivedFrom.description: San Pedro Sula Tiempo.hn reports that several demonstrations snarled traffic in the nation's capital Tegucigalpa yesterday as three separate demonstrations took to the streets. The National Enterprise for Electric Power Workers Union was rejecting the privatization of government services
derivedFrom.headline: Caos vial: Caliente jornada de protestas en la capital [Road chaos: Warm day of protests in the capital]

derivedFrom.description: San Pedro Sula Tiempo.hn reports that several demonstrations snarled traffic in the nation's capital Tegucigalpa yesterday as three separate demonstrations took to the streets. The Association for Campesino Development of El Progreso demonstrated to support plans by the National Agrarian Institute to expropriate private lands in favor of campesinos.
derivedFrom.headline: Caos vial: Caliente jornada de protestas en la capital [Road chaos: Warm day of protests in the capital]

derivedFrom.description: Workers at Enmore Sugar Estate yesterday began a planned three-day strike to sound their dissatisfaction over the terms of an agreement for salary increases for years they were underpaid by GuySuCo.
derivedFrom.headline: Enmore sugar workers strike over ‘flawed’ salary agreement

derivedFrom.description: The union of employees of the National Civil Aviation and Aviation Infrastructure (Dinacia) moved yesterday to demand better wages and payment for items that are owed to workers. The move meant delaying the delivery of the plans of commercial flights. At first it was assumed that the measure would force later off to different aeronautical services.
derivedFrom.headline: Protest did not affect flight departures

derivedFrom.description: Last Tuesday, community people from the Potosi’s locality of Mallku Khota  started a 300 km march toward La Paz against mining exploration in the region, demanding the ousting of the Canadian mining company South American Silver.
derivedFrom.headline: Mining Conflict: March Begins, and the Government Says That It will Consult; Conflicto minero: inician marcha y el Gobierno dice que hará consulta

derivedFrom.description: State workers across Colombia held a 24-hour strike on May 30. The action was accompanied by protest marches in Bogotá and other major cities. A principal demand was the negotiation of a petition for salary raises and labor improvements that they had presented to President Juan Manuel Santos toward the end of 2010.
derivedFrom.headline: Bicitaxistas marcharon con Fecode [Pedicab Drivers March with the Fecode (Colombian Federation of Educators)]

derivedFrom.description: On May 30th, around a thousand miners from the 26 of February Cooperative took the Colquiri Mine by force, leaving 15 injured.
derivedFrom.headline: The taking of a mine leaves 15 injured Colquiri; Toma de mina Colquiri deja 15 heridos

derivedFrom.description: The protest, which took place in a public square before the parliament building in Asunción, was convened under the name "After office revolutionary." The mobilized demanded, among other things, elimination of the ‘listas sábana.’ The lists represent a system in which the public vote for a list of candidates which has been predetermined by each party rather than voting for specific individuals.
derivedFrom.headline: La indignación ciudadana sigue (Citizen Outrage Continues)

derivedFrom.description: About 50 people demonstrated in the street protesting the end of the paving work at the site.
derivedFrom.headline: Protest by residents of Villa Sol September causes traffic jam on Camino Lo Echevers; Protesta de vecinos de Villa Sol de Septiembre provoca atochamiento en Camino Lo Echevers

derivedFrom.description: UCV workers protest on Wednesday outside the headquarters of Psotgrados which meets the University Council
derivedFrom.headline: UCV workers protest for CU meeting

derivedFrom.description: Students who were punished for the protests on 5/25, protested  outside U.Panama dentistry building and beat up camerman covering the protest.
derivedFrom.headline: Universitarios expulsados golpean a camarógrafo; clases siguen suspendidas (Expelled University Students Beat Up Cameraman; Classes Remain Suspended)
derivedFrom.comments: As with the 5/25 protest, this is classified as "other". The students are protesting the school's disciplinary action against them for the their 5/25 protest. Not sure I can 'broadly' apply "other governmental policies" to a school disciplinary action.

derivedFrom.description: Colombian government workers go on strike
derivedFrom.headline: Funcionarios del Estado colombiano, en huelga [Colombian State Officials, on Strike]

derivedFrom.description: Ex-military protesting over benefits, annuities  clash with police
derivedFrom.headline: Former military wounded and arrested after clash with police
derivedFrom.comments: The veterans are asking the government for land, property, specialized medical care, and pensions, but not wages. Coded as 0152.

derivedFrom.description: The residents of the neighborhoods of Belgrano, Palermo, and Barrio Norte gathered to protest against corruption, lack of security, and the tie of the local currency to the dollar.  They were also protesting measures adopted by the government regulating the purchase of foreign currency.
derivedFrom.headline: Pot-Banging Protest against the Government in the Argentine Capital; Cacerolazo en contra del Gobierno en la Capital
derivedFrom.comments: The protesters are simply banging pots (caceralazo) and not doing anything violent, there this is labeled 0141

derivedFrom.description: Sugarcane workers protest the expropriation of 94% of a foreign-owned sugar company, Azucerera S.A. del Norte
derivedFrom.headline: Empleados de azucarera protestan ante oficinas del Instituto Nacional Agrario en Tegucigalpa  [Sugarcane Employees Protest in Front of the Offices of the National Institute of Agriculture in Tegucigalpa]

derivedFrom.description: Demanding better health care, ethnic indians occupy the offices of the Special Secretariat of Indigenous Health (Sheshai) in three cities and the capital and block traffic on five highways in the southern states of Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul
derivedFrom.headline: Índios bloqueiam rodovias e ocupam prédios em 3 estados (Indigenous People Block Roads and Occupy Offices in Three States)

derivedFrom.description: Demanding better health care, ethnic indians occupy the offices of the Special Secretariat of Indigenous Health (Sheshai) in three cities and the capital and block traffic on five highways in the southern states of Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul
derivedFrom.headline: Índios bloqueiam rodovias e ocupam prédios em 3 estados (Indigenous People Block Roads and Occupy Offices in Three States)

derivedFrom.description: Administrative workers of the Superior Court of Justice of Arequipa go on an indefinite strike demanding a wage increase.
derivedFrom.headline: Trabajadores judiciales en Arequipa se declaran en huelga por mejores sueldos (Court Workers Strike for Better Pay)

derivedFrom.description: Lima Judiciary enter indefinite strike demanding wage increases.
derivedFrom.headline: Trabajadores judiciales acatan huelga indefinida pidiendo alza de sueldos  (Court Workers Begin Indefinite Strike for Pay Raise)

derivedFrom.description: Indefinite strike called in the city of Cajamarca by different organizations against the Conga mining project.
derivedFrom.headline: Perú: Cajamarca, paralizada en reinicio de protestas contra proyecto minero Conga (Peru: Cajamarca, Paralyzed by Restart of Protests against Conga Mining Project)
